header.title: Gemini Nano Playground
header.subtitle: Test the Prompt API directly in your browser.

temperature.label: Temperature
temperature.description: Controls response creativity. Higher values generate more creative and unpredictable responses.

topK.label: Top-K
topK.description: Limits the number of tokens considered. Lower values generate more focused responses.

status.downloading: Downloading model. This may take a few minutes.
status.modelUnavailable: Model unavailable. Check hardware and system requirements.
status.sessionReady: Session ready with Temperature={{temperature}} and Top-K={{topK}}.
status.apiNotFound: LanguageModel API not found. Make sure you're in Chrome with the correct flags.

app.setupDescription: Click "Start" on the side panel to begin.
app.downloadingDescription: The model is being downloaded in the background.

prompt.placeholder: Type your question or prompt here...
prompt.label: Type your question or prompt:
prompt.startPrompt: Type your question above to get started

suggestions.title: Prompt suggestions:
examples: Create a JavaScript function to sort arrays

alert.title: Gemini Nano API Not Available
alert.description: It seems the Gemini Nano API is not available in your browser. This may be because you are not using Chrome Canary/Dev, experimental flags are not enabled, or your system does not meet the requirements.

introduction.title: What is Gemini Nano?
introduction.description: Gemini Nano is Google's on-device AI model that runs locally in Chrome. It enables powerful AI features without sending data to external servers, ensuring privacy and fast responses.

requirements.title: System Requirements
requirements.gpuValue: Over 4 GB VRAM (or use CPU bypass - see below)

step1.title: Get Chrome Canary or Dev Channel
step1.description: You need Chrome Canary or Dev channel to access experimental AI features:

step2.title: Enable Experimental Flags
step2.chromeFlags: Open Chrome and navigate to the flags page:
step2.relaunchDescription: Click the "Relaunch" button that appears at the bottom of the page.

step3.title: CPU Processing (Optional)
step3.description: Don't have a dedicated GPU with 4+ GB VRAM? Enable CPU processing with this additional flag:
step3.searchFlag: Search for this flag and set it to "Enabled"
step3.ignoreGpu: This ignores GPU requirements and uses CPU
step3.performance: Performance may be slower, but still functional

step4.title: Installation Verification
step4.devtools: Open DevTools (F12) and execute this command in the console:
step4.shouldReturn: This should return "available" if everything is working correctly.
step4.checkDownload: Check the model download status at:
step4.lookFor: Look for the "Optimization Guide On Device Model" component.

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.apiNotFound: API not found: Ensure you are using Chrome Canary/Dev and have enabled the flags.
troubleshooting.modelUnavailable: Model unavailable: Check hardware requirements or enable CPU bypass.
troubleshooting.downloadProblems: Download problems: Ensure you have enough space and an unmetered connection.
troubleshooting.stillNotWorking: Still not working: Try restarting Chrome and checking chrome://components.

footer.documentation: For more detailed information, visit the

footer.description: Gemini Nano - Language model running directly in the browser
